title: Plane of Fire
data:
| Plane of Fire                                       |                                                       |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level -3 of the [End Game](/wiki/End_Game "End Game") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | No                                                    |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                                   |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                                    |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                    |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | Yes                                                   |

The **Plane of Fire** is the third of the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes"). The level is full of [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"), [fire elementals](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental"), [salamanders](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander"), [pit fiends](/wiki/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend"), [fire](/wiki/Fire_vortex "Fire vortex") and [steam vortices](/wiki/Steam_vortex "Steam vortex"), [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), and even a guaranteed [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon"). Only monsters with fire resistance will be randomly generated.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The level is no-teleport and has an undiggable floor. It is ineligible to leave bones files.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Map

.................[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava").............[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")............[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")...[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava").........[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava").......  
.................................[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")....................[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")[}](/wiki/Lava "Lava")...................

You will arrive at the point marked in the lower-right. The portal to the [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water") is located on dry land, but not in the lower-right portion of the map (marked)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2). The entire level is unlit. There are 40 fire traps placed at random on the level.

Monsters on the level, randomly located, include a red dragon, a balrog, 19 fire elementals, six fire vortices, six hell hounds, two stone golems, three barbed devils, three pit fiends, five fire giants, a scorpion, a dust vortex, three pit vipers, eight salamanders, a minotaur, and two steam vortices.

The lava on this level emits [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud") (#) randomly - beware of poison damage, and make sure you have some way to quickly cure blindness.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit d3e80bf9](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/d3e80bf9bf3da8e78d51e67ee5a57addf3ea49e8), the Plane of Fire is slightly bigger.

Also, as of [commit 6acf5a77](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/6acf5a778407a5a8bdba6c14cd016d9e40980f7a), the ground on the Plane of Fire is hot and may destroy potions.

## Strategy

Upon arrival in the Plane of Fire, you may be banged up from [air elementals](/wiki/Air_elemental "Air elemental") in the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"). You may wish to allow a [fire vortex](/wiki/Fire_vortex "Fire vortex") to [engulf](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") you; not even the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") can harm you while you are engulfed.

The Plane of Fire is liberally salted with [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), thus a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection") will not easily [find](/wiki/Portal_detection_methods "Portal detection methods") the [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") to the [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water"). You will probably want [confused](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") gold detection to distinguish the portal from the fire traps. Another side effect to the numerous fire traps is that, since most of the monsters on the Plane of Fire are immune to fire, you will practically be swarmed with a mind-numbing myriad of messages generated from monsters triggering them, potentially causing you to skip past messages that are a [Bad Idea](/wiki/Bad_Idea "Bad Idea") to skip. Coupled with lots of [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict") inter-monster battle messages, this motivates some players to wear a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") throughout this level. You can also turn off the "sparkle" [option](/wiki/Option "Option") to skip resist animations.

Be careful not to get stuck in the lava! Continued [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") is advisable.

## History

The emission of poison clouds was introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 60](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/makemon.c#line60 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/makemon.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [Source:NetHack 3.4.3/dat/endgame.des#Fire](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/dat/endgame.des#Fire "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/dat/endgame.des")

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d6/Nh360-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-360}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Plane of Fire

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Plane of Fire
Location Level -3 of the
End Game
Bones No
Mappable Yes
Teleportable No
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls Yes

The Plane of Fire is the third of the Elemental Planes. The level is full of lava, fire elementals, salamanders, pit fiends, fire and steam vortices, fire traps, and even a guaranteed red dragon. Only monsters with fire resistance will be randomly generated.[1]

The level is no-teleport and has an undiggable floor. It is ineligible to leave bones files.

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

You will arrive at the point marked in the lower-right. The portal to the Plane of Water is located on dry land, but not in the lower-right portion of the map (marked)[2]. The entire level is unlit. There are 40 fire traps placed at random on the level.

Monsters on the level, randomly located, include a red dragon, a balrog, 19 fire elementals, six fire vortices, six hell hounds, two stone golems, three barbed devils, three pit fiends, five fire giants, a scorpion, a dust vortex, three pit vipers, eight salamanders, a minotaur, and two steam vortices.

The lava on this level emits poison clouds (#) randomly - beware of poison damage, and make sure you have some way to quickly cure blindness.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As of commit d3e80bf9, the Plane of Fire is slightly bigger.

Also, as of commit 6acf5a77, the ground on the Plane of Fire is hot and may destroy potions.

Strategy

Upon arrival in the Plane of Fire, you may be banged up from air elementals in the Plane of Air. You may wish to allow a fire vortex to engulf you; not even the Wizard of Yendor can harm you while you are engulfed.

The Plane of Fire is liberally salted with fire traps, thus a cursed scroll of gold detection will not easily find the magic portal to the Plane of Water. You will probably want confused gold detection to distinguish the portal from the fire traps. Another side effect to the numerous fire traps is that, since most of the monsters on the Plane of Fire are immune to fire, you will practically be swarmed with a mind-numbing myriad of messages generated from monsters triggering them, potentially causing you to skip past messages that are a Bad Idea to skip. Coupled with lots of conflict inter-monster battle messages, this motivates some players to wear a blindfold throughout this level. You can also turn off the "sparkle" option to skip resist animations.

Be careful not to get stuck in the lava! Continued levitation is advisable.

History

The emission of poison clouds was introduced in NetHack 3.6.0.

References

  1. ↑ makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 60
  2. ↑ Source:NetHack 3.4.3/dat/endgame.des#Fire

rawPage:
{{level|Plane of Fire| |branch=End Game |from=-3|to=-3 |bones=no |mapping=yes |teleport=no |digfloor=no |digwalls=yes }} The '''Plane of Fire''' is the third of the [[Elemental Planes]]. The level is full of [[lava]], [[fire elemental]]s, [[salamander]]s, [[pit fiend]]s, [[fire vortex|fire]] and [[steam vortex|steam vortices]], [[fire trap]]s, and even a guaranteed [[red dragon]]. Only monsters with fire resistance will be randomly generated.{{refsrc|makemon.c|60}} The level is no-teleport and has an undiggable floor. It is ineligible to leave bones files. ==Map==
@=[[you|{{white|@}}]] X={{white|.}} ............................................................................ ....LLLLLLLL............L.......................LLL......................... ...LL...................L......................LLLL................LL....... ...L.............LLLL...LL....LL...............LLLLL.............LLL........ .LLLL..............LL....L.....LLL..............LLLL..............LLLL...... ..........LLLL...LLLL...LLL....LLL......L........LLLL....LL........LLL...... ........LLLLLLL...LL.....L......L......LL.........LL......LL........LL...L.. ........LL..LLL..LL......LL......LLLL..L.........LL......LLL............LL.. ....L..LL....LLLLL.................LLLLLLL.......L......LL............LLLLLL ....L..L.....LL.LLLL.......L............L........LLLLL.LL......LL.........LL ....LL........L...LL......LL.............LLL.....L...LLL.......LLL.........L .....LLLLLL........L.......LLL.............L....LL...L.LLL......LLLLLLL..... ..........LLLL............LL.L.............L....L...LL.........LLL..LLL..... ...........................LLLLL...........LL...L...L........LLLLXXLLLLLLXXX .....LLLL.............LL....LL.......LLL...LL.......L..LLL....LLLLLLLXXXXXXX .......LLL.........LLLLLLLLLLL......LLLLL...L...........LL...LL..XLLXXXXXXXX .........LL.......LL.........LL.......LLL....L..LLL....LL........XLLX@XXXXXX ..........LLLLLLLLL...........LL....LLL.......LLLLL.....LL.......XLLXXXXXXXX .................L.............LLLLLL............LL...LLLL.......XXLLXXXXXXX .................................LL....................LL........XXXXXXXXXXX
You will arrive at the point marked in the lower-right. The portal to the [[Plane of Water]] is located on dry land, but not in the lower-right portion of the map (marked)[[Source:NetHack 3.4.3/dat/endgame.des#Fire]]. The entire level is unlit. There are 40 fire traps placed at random on the level. Monsters on the level, randomly located, include a red dragon, a balrog, 19 fire elementals, six fire vortices, six hell hounds, two stone golems, three barbed devils, three pit fiends, five fire giants, a scorpion, a dust vortex, three pit vipers, eight salamanders, a minotaur, and two steam vortices. The lava on this level emits [[poison cloud]]s ({{brightgreen|#}}) randomly - beware of poison damage, and make sure you have some way to quickly cure blindness. {{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|As of {{commit|d3e80bf9bf3da8e78d51e67ee5a57addf3ea49e8}}, the Plane of Fire is slightly bigger. Also, as of {{commit|6acf5a778407a5a8bdba6c14cd016d9e40980f7a}}, the ground on the Plane of Fire is hot and may destroy potions.}} ==Strategy== Upon arrival in the Plane of Fire, you may be banged up from [[air elemental]]s in the [[Plane of Air]]. You may wish to allow a [[fire vortex]] to [[engulf]] you; not even the [[Wizard of Yendor]] can harm you while you are engulfed. The Plane of Fire is liberally salted with [[fire trap]]s, thus a [[cursed]] [[scroll of gold detection]] will not easily [[Portal detection methods|find]] the [[magic portal]] to the [[Plane of Water]]. You will probably want [[confusion|confused]] gold detection to distinguish the portal from the fire traps. Another side effect to the numerous fire traps is that, since most of the monsters on the Plane of Fire are immune to fire, you will practically be swarmed with a mind-numbing myriad of messages generated from monsters triggering them, potentially causing you to skip past messages that are a [[Bad Idea]] to skip. Coupled with lots of [[conflict]] inter-monster battle messages, this motivates some players to wear a [[blindfold]] throughout this level. You can also turn off the "sparkle" [[option]] to skip resist animations. Be careful not to get stuck in the lava! Continued [[levitation]] is advisable. ==History== The emission of poison clouds was introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.0]]. == References == {{DOD}} {{nethack-360}} [[Category:Planes]]
